verse: 1 The holy Ghost promiseth, that the condition of the Church which was in misery after the captivity of Babylon, should be restored to great excellency.â€ƒ4 So that there should be nothing more comfortable, than to be numbered among the members thereof.
God laid his foundations among the holy mountains.
The Lord loveth the gates of Zion above all the habitations of Jacob.
Glorious things are spoken of thee, O city of God. Selah.
I will make mention of Rahab and Babel among them that know me: behold Palestine and Tyre with Ethiopia, There is he born.
And of Zion it shall be said, Many are born in her: and he, even the most High shall stablish her.
The Lord shall count, when he writeth the people, He was born there. Selah.
As well the singers as the players on instruments shall praise thee: all my springs are in thee.
